document.masterDocTitle: The type specimens of Papilionoidea in the collection of the National Museum of Natural History, Sofia (Lepidoptera)

bibRefCitation.author: Beshkov, S.
bibRefCitation.refString: Beshkov, S. (1996) A new subspecies of Erebia cassioides (Reiner & Hohenwarth, 1792) from Bulgaria: Erebia cassioides kinoshitai subsp. n. (Lepidoptera: Nymphalidae: Satyrinae). Phegea, 24 (3), 109 - 124.

subSubSection.paragraph:
“
Erebia cassioides kinoshitai
ssp. nova ” ( Beshkov 1996: 109–121 , Pl. 1: Figs 1–4, 8–9 , 14–21 ). Type locality: “ Bulgaria , Central Stara Planina Mt, under Ravnetz Top, 1920 m alt.”, originally designated ( Beshkov 1996: 119 ).

materialsCitation.collectorName: S. Beshkov & V. Gastarov & S. Beshkov.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 3–10. Papilionoidea types from NMNHS collection. Fig. 3—
Colias caucasica balcanica
, paralectotype ♂; Fig. 4—same, paralectotype ♀; Fig. 5—same, paralectotype ♀; Fig. 6—
Erebia ligea
ab. borisi , ♂; Fig. 7—
E. neleus centrorilica
, paratype ♂; Fig. 8—same, paratype ♀; Fig. 9—
E. neleus kinoshitai
, holotype ♂; Fig. 10—same, paratype ♀.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Valid subspecies of
Erebia neleus (Freyer, 1832) ( Wiemers et al. 2018 )
, endemic for the alpine part of Balkan (Stara Planina) Mountains, Bulgaria .
